name: places/ChIJ0UhOAeFYwokR0QZ-NEgkMWE
formattedAddress: 60 Sutton Pl S #1CN, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 60 Sutton Pl S #1CN, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text: Dr. Manevitz is a caring, forward thinking and "out of the box" doctor who is skilled when it comes to psychopharmacology if medicine is the route you want to take and they do Ketamine  treatments. Other Pro's: I believe he really wants his patients to get better.  The nurse tech staff is great with an efficient easy system of prescription refills. The office adhere's to an all encompassing  "one stop shop" that different treatments. Lastly, you can usually get an appt. with him.

originalText.text: This man is a brilliant person let alone doctor. Any issue you could have as a person will be attended with the most amazing care. Dr Manevitz is a great guy he’s understanding of any situation. If you’re in trouble and have had a try at other doctors whether it be for improvement or to talk this guy can do. He makes that time he’s with you all about you, and he also goes the extra mile to help you realize and bring sense to your issues and help define them not only by text book but by feeling. Please take the time to try  him if you feel like you need some help.

originalText.text:
I don’t understand the negative reviews I see on here. I’ve been going to Dr. Manevitz for over ten years and find him to be completely invested in my health and success, almost to the point where I wonder about the personal sacrifices he makes for his patients.

Every time I’ve needed him he’s been there for me. Sometimes sessions can be slightly unorthodox but I also keep in touch via text (mainly me writing updates and thoughts) but his memory of details and intuitive understanding of dynamics is unparalleled in any human I’ve ever met. Trust me, he hears and retains every detail of everything said during session.

I’ve made a lot of personal progress and still am working through issues. I’m so happy to have his support, knowledge and care. A true professional.

originalText.text:
I went through Hell in New York City from 2005 to 2016.
Dr. Manevitz was probably my Doctor for the last five years of it.
I had more appointments than I can count which were two minutes or less.
He should probably stick to doing his television interviews and whatever else keeps him away from live human beings.
From what I saw: the better the insurance the patient had the better the treatment.
Alternatively: he may have been a big fan of Wu Tang Clan's hit song "C.R.E.A.M."- Cash Rules Everything Around Me.

originalText.text: He helped for decades thousands of people, of whom I refereed too, with dignity and with moral, with a distinct psychological and noble approach to the various clients coming from various culture, race, religion, etc. People who were about to forsake their life found a new and joyful life with relief and with a with peace, health and tranquility. His medical approach is unique; no wonder that he has need recommend year after year, by New York Magazine, "Best Doctors." Can't recommend any better doctor for any one inflicted with any mental issue.
